intro: Hieracium aemilianense, commonly known as the Emilian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
